meanings.definition: Not in accordance with what is usual or normal.
meanings.sent1: The bright purple sky looked very unnatural.
meanings.sent2: The cat's ability to speak was unnatural.
meanings.sent3: It was quite unnatural to see a dog wearing sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the bustling city was as unnatural as a fish climbing a tree.
meanings.sent5: The glowing mushrooms in the forest were an unnatural sight.

meanings.definition: Contrary to the laws or course of nature.
meanings.sent1: The floating rock was an unnatural phenomenon.
meanings.sent2: The sudden snowstorm in summer was unnatural.
meanings.sent3: It seemed unnatural for the sun to rise from the west.
meanings.sent4: The bird's ability to swim underwater was as unnatural as a fish flying in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The tree growing upside down was an unnatural sight.

meanings.sent1: The plastic flowers looked very unnatural in the garden.
meanings.sent3: It was unnatural to see a clock made of cheese.
meanings.sent4: The city's neon lights created an unnatural glow in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The synthetic fur felt unnatural to the touch.
